headline: How Amcor’s Higher Dividend and US$2.5 Billion Portfolio Review At Amcor (AMCR) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: In early February 2026, Amcor reported past-quarter sales of US$5,449 million and net income of US$177 million, while also declaring a higher quarterly cash dividend of US$0.65 per share (and A$0.93 per CDI) following its recent 1-for-5 reverse stock split. The Board’s decision to lift the dividend, alongside earnings where income rose but earnings per share fell, highlights management’s emphasis on cash generation even as a portfolio review covering US$2.50 billion of sales introduces...

The Board’s decision to lift the dividend, alongside earnings where income rose but earnings per share fell, highlights management’s emphasis on cash generation even as a portfolio review covering US$2.50 billion of sales introduces...
